item.title: Polish conference recommended vitamin D levels from 30 to 60 ng
item.description:
“Vitamin D – Minimum, maximum, optimum” Warsaw, Poland, Oct. 19-20, 2012

By William B. Grant, Ph.D., Sunlight, Nutrition, and Health Research Center, San Francisco, CA

A vitamin D conference, “Vitamin D – Minimum, maximum, optimum” was held in Warsaw, Poland, Oct. 19-20, 2012, to develop guidelines for vitamin D for Central and Eastern Europe. It was organized by Pawel Plodowski and Elzbieta Karczmarewicz. There were 550 attendees from Poland and other countries.

item.title: Vitamin D Workshop Houston 2012
item.description:
15th Annual: Texas June 20-22, 2012 Website

Recent Vitamin D workshops have generally had

  • 300 to 400 attendees

  • from 20 to 30 countries

  • 40-70 verbal presentations

  • 300-400 poster presentations

Tentative Speakers and Topics as of April 2012

(Just a few of the speakers and topics have hyperlinks added)
Andrew Annalora xray structure of the CYP24A1 vitamin D enzyme
Christine Ambrosone Breast cancer
Paul Anderson What are the implications of local 1a-hydroxylase activity in bone cells
Daniel Bikle PROTECTIVE ROLE OF VITAMIN D SIGNALING IN SKIN CANCER FORMATION
Martin Blomberg-Jensen Vitamin D and male reproduction: evidence for non-genomic effects
Roger Bouillon Modest vitamin D supplementation is the best strategy worldwide
Geert Carmeliet Consequences of selective VDR deletion in osteoblasts
Scott Cramer VDR actions in prostate stem cells
David Feldman ANTICANCER ACTIVITY OF DIETARY VITAMIN D3 IN MOUSE XENOGRAFT MODELS OF BREAST AND PROSTATE CANCER
Christopher Gallagher Role of 1a,25(OH)2D3 in cutaneous infections
David Gardner Cardiac specific VDR KO
Edward Giovannucci Vitamin D doses and 25(OH)D circulating levels, Random Control Trials and good Health;
What we have learned and what remains to be solved
Robert Heaney High 25(OH)D3
Pamela Hershberger Insights into vitamin D – Lung Cancer Relationships
Martin Hewison Immune regulation
Candace Johnson Proliferation and cell cycle progression
Shigeaki Kato TBA
Rebecca Mason The role of the vitamin D receptor and ERp57 in DNA photoprotection by 1,25(OH)2D3
Chantal Mathieu Vitamin D and its analogues as modulators of the immune system: the case of type 1 diabetes
Alison Mondul Consideration of 25(OH)D and DBP levels on the incidence of prostate cancer and bladder cancer; A challenge
Hector Palmer Vitamin D and Wnt/?-catenin pathways crosstalk in epidermal stem cell lineage selection and tumorigenesis
Wesley Pike Intestinal gene expression
Ann Prentice Status of rickets worldwide
Karl Schlingmann 24-Hydroxylase mutations in idiopathic infantile hypercalcemia
Gary Schwartz Serum calcium levels and the risk of prostate cancer
Rene St. Arnaud Biological roles of 1a,24(OH)2D3 and 24,25(OH)2D3 in bone
Naoyuki Takahashi MECHANISM OF INHIBITORY ACTION OF ELDECALCITOL, AN ACTIVE VITAMIN D ANALOG, ON BONE RESORPTION IN VIVO
Carol Wagner Update on pregnancy/lactation intervention trials

item.description:
Conference Abstracts are in a combination of German and English in PDF file attached at bottom of this page

The following are the results of Google Translate

The German Foundation for Health Information and Prevention (dsgip) was founded in 2009 as a charitable institution. Their name is their program. In the first step, it collects and sifts the latest research in medicine, natural sciences and the adjacent area in the sociological.

item.title: Vitamin D workshop- Rank - UK- 2009
item.description:
Proceedings of the Rank Forum on Vitamin D.

Br J Nutr. 2010 Dec 7:1-13.

Lanham-New SA, Buttriss JL, Miles LM, Ashwell M, Berry JL, Boucher BJ, Cashman KD, Cooper C, Darling AL, Francis RM, Fraser WD, de Groot CP, Hyppönen E, Kiely M, Lamberg-Allardt C, Macdonald HM, Martineau AR, Masud T, Mavroeidi A, Nowson C, Prentice A, Stone EM, Reddy S, Vieth R, Williams CM.

Nutritional Sciences Division, Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences, University of Surrey, Guildford GU2 7XH, UK.
